Description: Set Game Difficulty
Set Game Mode Type as PVE or PVP
Player's ability to damage enemy castles
Setting for Siege Golem Health
Setting for when players can damage other players (Disabled in PvE)
Defines interactions with enemy Castle Hearts

EnumValues.CanBeDestroyedOnlyWhenDecaying: Can Be Destroyed Only When Decaying
EnumValues.CanBeSeizedOrDestroyedByPlayers: Can Be Seized Or Destroyed By Players

Description: The duration where players cannot be damage by other players when joining a PvP server in seconds
Defines who may loot the body when a player dies
Defines if soul shard items are unique (only one of each per server) or if a new one spawns every time a soul shard boss is slain
If players may loot enemy stashes, containers, and crafting stations
When enabled, most equipment will not be dropped upon death
When enabled, some items will prevent you from using waygates
When enabled, some items will prevent you from transforming into a bat
Allow players to write messages that all players on the server can read
Determines whether all waygates are active or inactive when in a new world
Seizing an enemy player castle heart requires no materials
Destroying an enemy player castle heart requires no materials
Inactive players are automatically killed after a set duration
Minimum timer before inactive player is killed in seconds based on gear level
If dead disconnected players are disabled
The time for a disconnected dead player to become disabled
Multiplies the amount of items that can be combined into a single stack (Min: 0.25, Max: 5.0)
Multiplies all droptables with this factor granting more or less drops from kills and chests (Min: 0.25, Max: 5.0)
Multiplies the amount of loot received from successful servant hunts (Min: 0.25, Max: 5.0)
Multiplies the amount of materials received from harvesting resource nodes (Min: 0.25, Max: 5.0)
Multiplies the amount of blood essence received from defeating enemies (Min: 0.25, Max: 5.0)
Multiplies the additional respawn duration players suffer from being slain in PvP
The number of minimum tiles where players can place a castle heart and/or floors next to another heart
Maximum amount of players per Clan
Rate for how quickly players loose blood. A higher rate results in higher blood consumption
Multiplies the amount of durability suffered from dealing or receiving damage
Affects the rate of how quickly garlic stack when exposed
Multiplies the effect of the Holy element
Affects the damage received when carrying silver items
Affects the duration a player may stand in the sun before starting to take damage
Rate for how quickly a castle deteriorate when the castle heart has run out of Blood Essence
Rate for how quickly a castle consumes blood essence. A higher rate results in higher blood essence consumption

Amount of time a castle is deemed as breached when players break through the outer defenses. Players may not construct new structures or walls while a castle is breached and all structures are susceptible to damage while in this state

Amount of time where players are blocked from building structures or walls while under attack. A castle is deemed under attack whenever enemy players manages to deal damage to any wall or door using explosives or siege golems
Shows a system message in the chat when a Siege Golem is being summoned
Show Siege Golems on the big map
Multiplies the amount of materials required to build structures
Multiplies the cost of crafting items
Multiplies the cost of crafting items (Min: 0.1)
Multiplies the cost of researching (Min: 0.1)
Multiplies the cost of refining items (Min: 0.1)
Rate for how quickly materials are refined. A higher rate result in more rapid refinement (Min: 0.1)
Modifies the speed of research (Min: 0.1)
The material reimbursement players receive from dismantling a structure (Min: 0.1)
Rate for how quickly humans turn into servants. A higher rate result in more rapid conversion (Min: 0.1)
Modifies the cost for repairing an item
The amount of durability loss that equipment suffer upon death when defeated in PvP

Durability loss suffered upon death is dropped as materials. This value defines the amount of materials that are either lost or dropped. A value of 0 results in all materials being lost while a value of 1 results in all materials being dropped
DisplayName: Death Durability Loss Factor As Resources

Description: Multiplies the amount of stock a trader has. A higher value results in more items in stock. (Min: 0.1)
Multiplies the price of items in the trader inventory. A higher value results in higher prices. (Min: 0.1)
Multiplies the amount of time it takes for a trader to restock their inventory. A higher value results in a longer restock time. (Min: 0.1)
A list of Steam64 IDs for players that are in-game admins. [Find your Steam64 ID](https://steamid.io/lookup/)
A list of Steam64 IDs for players that are banned [Find a Steam64 ID](https://steamid.io/lookup/)

The maximum frequency for how often a blood moon may occur

Enables API access (Undocumented feature)
Sets the server release stream to install. Note: Update the server after changing this setting

If set, BepInEx will be installed when the server is updated and enabled when the server is run, allowing the server to be modded. Mods must be installed in the BepInEx/plugins directory, which is created after BepInEx is first run. Requires Wine 8 staging build on Linux (and Xvfb and cabextract)
